summary.intent: Address PR review feedback about inaccurate documentation claiming session_id appears on every log line when it can actually be empty, and resolve merge conflicts with main branch.
summary.outcome: Fixed documentation in logger.go and logging.md to clarify session_id behavior when empty, replied to both review threads, resolved merge conflicts by adopting main's strategy.FindMostRecentSession() while keeping the fix to not bail on empty session IDs, and pushed all changes with tests passing.

repo: Main branch changed from paths.ReadCurrentSession() to strategy.FindMostRecentSession() for session retrieval
New dependencies were added to main requiring go mod tidy after merge
The codebase uses Copilot for PR reviews which caught documentation accuracy issues

code.finding: Doc comment incorrectly stated session_id appears on 'every' log line, but when Init is called with empty string it won't be present
Merge conflict resolution required adopting strategy.FindMostRecentSession() from main while preserving the behavior to not bail on empty session IDs since log file handling was fixed

workflow: LSP diagnostics can show false positives (undefined function errors) before gopls re-indexes after merges
Running go mod tidy is necessary after merging branches that introduce new dependencies
Format, lint, and test should be run before committing merge resolutions to catch integration issues

friction: gopls showed undefined function errors for strategy.FindMostRecentSession before re-indexing after merge
Had to manually identify and run go mod tidy for new dependencies from main branch
